item.title: Quaternion Domain Super MDS for 3D Localization
item.description: arXiv:2504.17890v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We propose a novel low-complexity three-dimensional (3D) localization algorithm for wireless sensor networks, termed quaternion-domain super multidimensional scaling (QD-SMDS). This algorithm reformulates the conventional SMDS, which was originally developed in the real domain, into the quaternion domain. By representing 3D coordinates as quaternions, the method enables the construction of a rank-1 Gram edge kernel (GEK) matrix that integrates both relative distance and angular (phase) information between nodes, maximizing the noise reduction effect achieved through low-rank truncation via singular value decomposition (SVD). The simulation results indicate that the proposed method demonstrates a notable enhancement in localization accuracy relative to the conventional SMDS algorithm, particularly in scenarios characterized by substantial measurement errors.
item.dc:creator: Keigo Masuoka, Takumi Takahashi, Giuseppe Thadeu Freitas de Abreu, Hideki Ochiai

item.title: The sharp diameter bound of stable minimal surfaces
item.description: arXiv:2411.18928v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: For three dimensional complete Riemannian manifolds with scalar curvature no less than one, we obtain the sharp upper bound of complete stable minimal surfaces' diameter.
item.dc:creator: Qixuan Hu, Guoyi Xu, Shuai Zhang

item.title: Small genus, small index critical points of the systole function
item.description: arXiv:2504.17316v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper the index of a family of critical points of the systole function on Teichm\"uller space is calculated. The members of this family are interesting in that their existence implies the existence of strata in the Thurston spine for which the systoles do not determine a basis for the homology of the surface. Previously, index calculations of critical points with this pathological feature were impossible, because the only known examples were in surfaces with huge genus. A related concept is that of a ``minimal filling subset'' of the systoles at the critical point. Such minimal filling sets are studied, as they relate to the dimension of the Thurston spine near the critical point. We find an example of a minimal filling set of simple closed geodesics in genus 5 with cardinality 8, that are presumably realised as systoles. More generally, we determine the smallest and largest cardinality of a minimal filling set related to a tesselation of a hyperbolic surface by regular, right-angled $m$-gons for $m \in \{ 5, 6, 7 \}$. For this, we use integer linear programming together with a hand-tailored symmetry breaking technique.
item.dc:creator: Ni An, Ferdinand Ihringer, Ingrid Irmer
